summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from Bulletin Intelligence dated January 25, 2021. It summarizes major news stories across multiple categories including Capitol violence investigations, counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and international relations. Notably, it contains a brief mention that the FBI used Ghislaine Maxwell's phone to locate her, and covers various other FBI-related activities and political developments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief item stating the FBI used her phone to locate her.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Praised for being retained by President Biden; mentioned in context of FBI leadership.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned regarding travel restrictions, vaccine plans, and decision to keep FBI Director Wray.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Discussed in context of Capitol riot, impending impeachment trial, and pandemic response.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to Capitol riot and proposed independent commission.

persons.name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
persons.context: Alleged Capitol rioter threatened to assassinate her.

persons.name: Garret Miller
persons.context: Charged for storming the Capitol and threatening Rep. Ocasio-Cortez.

persons.name: Kevin Strong
persons.context: Arrested and charged for breaching the U.S. Capitol.

persons.name: Eric Munchel
persons.context: Blocked from release; found with plastic handcuffs and weapons.

persons.name: Guy W. Reffitt
persons.context: Arrested for Capitol violence; son tipped off FBI.

persons.name: Jackson Reffitt
persons.context: Reported his father to the FBI before the Capitol riot.

persons.name: Jessica Watkins
persons.context: Arrested for storming the Capitol and encouraging others.

persons.name: Ashli Babbitt
persons.context: Fatally shot by Capitol Police during the riot.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Mentioned regarding COVID-19 response and receiving mysterious powder.

persons.name: Gretchen Whitmer
persons.context: Target of foiled kidnapping plot; defendant set to plead guilty.

persons.name: Ty Garbin
persons.context: Scheduled to plead guilty to his alleged role.

persons.name: Chuck Grassley
persons.context: Asked DOJ for answers on closing Michael Flynn investigation.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Mentioned in context of investigation into leaked calls.

persons.name: Christopher Steele
persons.context: Told FBI he thought Fiona Hill knew dossier source.

persons.name: Fiona Hill
persons.context: Mentioned in declassified notes about Steele dossier.

persons.name: Kyle Rittenhouse
persons.context: Barred from associating with known white supremacists under new bail conditions.

persons.name: Daniel Cameron
persons.context: Grand jurors from Breonna Taylor investigation call for his impeachment.

persons.name: Esther Salas
persons.context: Target of a gunman; her son was killed and husband injured.

persons.name: Roy Den Hollander
persons.context: Attacked Judge Esther Salas's home, killing her son.

persons.name: Michael Madigan
persons.context: Remains center of federal corruption probe.

persons.name: Frank Figliuzzi
persons.context: Condemned efforts to attack FBI in his new book.

persons.name: David DeVillers
persons.context: Cleveland Plain Dealer editorial argues he should not be replaced amid corruption case.

persons.name: Ron Klain
persons.context: Praised Republican cooperation on cabinet nominees, urged Mayorkas confirmation.

persons.name: Mitch McConnell
persons.context: Effort to preserve filibuster; Schumer pushes back.

persons.name: Chuck Schumer
persons.context: Pushes back on McConnell's filibuster effort.

persons.name: Mitt Romney
persons.context: Believes impeachment trial is necessary; voted to convict Trump in first trial.

connections.description: The FBI used Ghislaine Maxwell's phone to locate her.
Son reported father to the FBI for involvement in Capitol violence.
Rioters were pro-Trump supporters who stormed the Capitol after his speech.
Steele told FBI he thought Hill knew his dossier source.
Fauci reflected on difficulties of working with Trump on pandemic response.

events.title: Capitol Riot
events.description: Pro-Trump mob stormed the U.S. Capitol, leading to multiple arrests, deaths, and an impeachment of former President Trump.

events.title: House Delivers Impeachment Article
events.description: House transmits article of impeachment against former President Trump for incitement of insurrection to the Senate, triggering trial process.

events.title: Operation Lost Angels
events.description: FBI-led multiagency operation found 33 missing children in Southern California, some being sexually exploited.

events.title: Biden Announces Travel Restrictions
events.description: President Biden reinstates and broadens COVID-19 travel restrictions on non-U.S. travelers from several countries.

events.title: Whitmer Kidnapping Plot
events.description: Ongoing case where defendants plotted to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer; one defendant set to plead guilty.

keyFacts: The FBI used Ghislaine Maxwell's phone to locate her, as mentioned in a brief news item.
Over 18 current/former police, firefighters, and military members have been charged for involvement in the Capitol riot.
FBI's Operation Lost Angels recovered 33 missing children in Southern California, with eight found being sexually exploited.
President Biden decided to retain Christopher Wray as FBI Director, a move praised in the briefing.
The briefing covers extensive investigations into the January 6 Capitol riot, including numerous arrests and charges.
